column1: allies in Ukraine. "It is not that we have not done it," Mrs Humeniuk told a news conference. "It is that we have not done it." The defence minister said the missile strikes were made to ensure the Russian military was not targeted. "We have done everything possible to stop these missile strikes. And we will continue to do so" said the defence minister. The Ukrainian president, Petro Poroshenko, said the attack was "a direct attack on the territory of the Russian Federation". The military did not specify what type of missile it was, but it appeared to be a Russian-made Kalibr-NK missile. The missile, it was not clear when it was made or if it had been supplied to the Ukrainian military. The Russian military had said it had carried out a joint strike with Ukraine to "defend the territorial integrity of the Russian Federation". The missile was made in the Ukrainian military's Black Sea fleet but, it was not clear if it was a Kalibr-NK or a similar missile. The missile was used by Russia as an anti-aircraft missile in a test in 2015 of its new anti-missile system. The government has said the missile was meant to hit a Buk missile defence system. The government would not say if it carried out the attack, but said it was not unusual for military aircraft to carry out attacks on Russian targets.
